snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move up and down.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move up and down.
snippet.name: 2 Way Vertical Movement

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events. Trigger the event MoveUp or MoveDown to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to move horizontally.
boolean.name: _PreventHorizontalMovement

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurning

snippet.desc: A button to switch to a different scene.
snippet.description: A button to switch to a different scene.
snippet.name: Switch Scene Button

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _NormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _PressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _HoverAnimation

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the switch scene transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

snippet.desc:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.description:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.name: Cannot Exit Scene

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make it die once it leaves the screen.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make it die once it leaves the screen.
snippet.name: Die On Leaving Screen

snippet.desc: Spawn an explosion and fragments when the actor dies.
snippet.description: Spawn an explosion and fragments when the actor dies.
snippet.name: Explode On Death

number.desc: The maximum speed at which the fragments fly away.
number.name: _MaximumSpeed

actortype.desc:
The actor type of the fragments to create.
Make sure the actor type of the fragments doesn't collide with this actor.
actortype.name: _FragmentActorType

number.desc: The number of fragments to create.
number.name: _NumberofFragments

number.desc: The maximum turning speed for the fragments.
number.name: _MaximumTurningSpeed

number.desc: The minimum speed at which the fragments fly away.
number.name: _MinimumSpeed

number.desc: An offset in the direction of movement at which the fragments will be created.
number.name: _Offset

actortype.desc:
The actor type of the explosion to create.
Make sure the actor type of the explosion doesn't collide with this actor.
actortype.name: _ExplosionActorType

snippet.desc: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.description: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.name: Health Manager

number.desc: Amount of health to start with.
number.name: _StartingHealth

number.desc: Maximum amount of health.
number.name: _MaximumHealth

number.desc: HIDDEN - Tracks the current amount of health.
number.name: _CurrentHealth

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is healed by any amount. Remove value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _HealedMessage

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is damaged by any amount. Remove the value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _DamagedMessage

text.desc:
What should we do when the health reaches zero?
1. Kill Actor
2. Do Nothing
text.name: _ZeroHealthAction

number.desc: How long should the Actor become temporarily invincible after being damaged?
number.name: _DelayBetweenDamage

boolean.desc: Check this box if the Actor's health should persist (stay the same) from scene to scene.
boolean.name: _PersistentHealth

game-attribute.desc:
Note: This option is only used if the Persistent Health? box is checked.

Select a Game Attribute to track the health for this Actor. Make sure the Attribute starts with a value of 0 (zero). Do not use the same attribute for more than one Actor.
game-attribute.name: _HealthGameAttribute

text.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The name of the game attribute created within the behaviour.
text.name: _HealthIdentifier

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is damaged.
sound.name: _DamageSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is killed.
sound.name: _DeathSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is healed.
sound.name: _HealSound

number.desc: Horizontal offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: xOffset

number.desc: Vertical offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: yOffset

number.desc: How long should the actor stay alive before disappearing? Leave at 0 to prevent the Actor from being removed.
number.name: lifespan

boolean.desc: Should the actor spawn another actor on death? Useful for death effects such as explosions.
boolean.name: _SpawnActorOnDeath

text.desc: Actor space (relative to upper left coordinate of Actor), or Screen Space (where 0,0 is upper left of screen)?
text.name: _DrawingLocation

number.desc: Horizontal offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarXOffset

number.desc: How many pixels should the outline be? Set to 0 to prevent an outline from drawing.
number.name: _HealthBarOutlineSize

number.desc: Vertical offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarYOffset

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarWidth

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarHeight

text.desc: Horizontal or Vertical?
text.name: _HealthBarOrientation

color.desc: Enter an outline colour that will display around the background of the health bar
color.name: _HealthBarOutlineColour

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 75%.
color.name: _ColourOver75

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 50%.
color.name: _ColourOver50

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 25%.
color.name: _ColourOver25

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is under 25%.
color.name: _ColourUnder25

color.desc: Background colour of the health bar.
color.name: _HealthBarBackgroundColour

boolean.desc: Whether a health bar should be drawn or not.
boolean.name: _DrawHealthBar

snippet.desc: A button to pause/unpause the game.
snippet.description: A button to pause/unpause the game.
snippet.name: Pause Button

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _NormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _PressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _HoverAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the activated button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _ActivatedNormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the activated button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _ActivatedPressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the activated button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _ActivatedHoverAnimation

snippet.desc: Switch to different scenes when an actor of a given type enters different regions.
snippet.description: Switch to different scenes when an actor of a given type enters different regions.
snippet.name: Region Scene Switcher

list.desc:
A list containing the ID of the region followed by the scene to switch to when entering this region. The format is
Region ID,Scene Name

Optionally you can also include coordinates where to spawn the actor in the next scene. In this case the format is
Region ID,Scene Name,X,Y
list.name: _RegionSceneList

actortype.desc: When an actor of this type enters one of the regions in the <var>Region Scene List<var/> it will trigger the scene switch.
actortype.name: _ActorType

boolean.desc: If selected, only switch scene, when <var>Switch Control</var> is pressed, while the actor is within a region.
boolean.name: _OnlySwitchOnKeyPress

control.desc: The Control to trigger the scene switch if <var>Only Switch On Key Press</var> is selected.
control.name: _SwitchControl

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the switch scene transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with something.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with something.
snippet.name: Die On Collision

snippet.desc: When the actor falls into a "pit" (e.g. off the bottom of the scene), it will be killed and the scene will reload.
snippet.description: When the actor falls into a "pit" (e.g. off the bottom of the scene), it will be killed and the scene will reload.
snippet.name: Die In Pit And Reload

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the reload transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

snippet.desc: Makes the actor follow the mouse.
snippet.description: Makes the actor follow the mouse.
snippet.name: Follow the Mouse

number.desc: The speed to move towards the mouse.
number.name: _Speed

number.desc: The actor will not move closer than this to the mouse.
number.name: _Margin

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will move faster if farther away from the mouse and slower if closer to to the mouse.
If unselected, the actor will move towards the target at a constant speed as specified in the Speed attribute.
boolean.name: _Easing

number.desc:
Only used when Easing is selected.
The actor will move at least at this speed. The actual speed depends on the distance to the mouse. The maximum speed is Minimum Easing Speed plus Speed. The actor will move at maximum speed if it is in the opposite diagonal corner of the mouse.
number.name: _MinimumEasingSpeed

text.desc:
Always: The actor will always follow the mouse.
When Pressed: The actor will follow the mouse only when it is pressed, and keep on moving when the mouse is released.
When Pressed, Else Stop: The actor will follow the mouse only when it is pressed, and stop when the mouse is released.
text.dropdown: Always=Always When Pressed=WhenPressed When Pressed, Else Stop=WhenPressedElseStop
text.name: _Follow

snippet.desc: Reload the scene when this actor dies.
snippet.description: Reload the scene when this actor dies.
snippet.name: Reload Scene On Death

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the reload transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

snippet.desc: Prevent the actor from leaving the screen.
snippet.description: Prevent the actor from leaving the screen.
snippet.name: Cannot Exit Screen

snippet.desc: Loop music when the scene is loaded.
snippet.description: Loop music when the scene is loaded.
snippet.name: Background Music

number.desc: The channel at which to play the music. Must be between 0 and 31 inclusive.
number.name: _Channel

boolean.desc: If selected, the sound on the selected channel will be stopped before the music starts.
boolean.name: _StopChannelFirst

snippet.desc: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.description: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.name: Fire Bullet

text.desc:
How to determine the direction of the bullets:

Relative - Treat Direction relative to the actor's orientation.
Absolute - Treat Direction as absolute.
Based on Animations - Determine the direction based on the current animation.
text.dropdown: Relative=Relative Absolute=Absolute Based on Animations=Based on Animations
text.name: _DirectionMode

number.desc: The speed at which the bullets will move.
number.name: _BulletSpeed

actortype.desc: The bullet actor type to create.
actortype.name: _BulletType

number.desc:
The direction in which the bullet will move.
Only used if Direction Mode is Relative or Absolute. If Direction Mode is Based on Animations the following four attributes determine the direction instead.
number.dropdown: North=-90 North East=-45 East=0 South East=45 South=90 South West=135 West=180 North West=-135
number.name: _Direction

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the bullets will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of actors to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

number.desc:
The maximum ammunition the actor can have.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _MaximumAmmunition

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammunition.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one on every shot.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

text.desc: Shoot up if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _UpAnimations

text.desc: Shoot down if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _DownAnimations

text.desc: Shoot left if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _LeftAnimations

text.desc: Shoot right if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _RightAnimations

snippet.desc: Pause when the game loses focus and optionally dim the screen while the game is paused.
snippet.description: Pause when the game loses focus and optionally dim the screen while the game is paused.
snippet.name: Pause On Losing Focus

control.desc: A key to pause/unpause the game.
control.name: _PauseControl

boolean.desc: Dim the screen when the game is paused.
boolean.name: _DimScreen

number.desc: The opacity used for dimming the screen.
number.name: _DimmingOpacity

color.desc: The color used for dimming the screen.
color.name: _DimmingColor

text.desc: This text is drawn at the center of the screen while the game is paused. Leave empty if no text should be drawn.
text.name: _PausedText

font.desc: The font used for the drawing the <var>Paused Text</var>.
font.name: _Font

snippet.desc: Keeps track of the number of items remaining in the specified actor group. Provides the option to switch scenes when the number of items reaches zero.
snippet.description: Keeps track of the number of items remaining in the specified actor group. Provides the option to switch scenes when the number of items reaches zero.
snippet.name: Items Remaining

actorgroup.desc: Specify the Actor Group that will be monitored
actorgroup.name: _MonitorActorGroup

text.desc: This is the message to send when there are no Actors left in the specified group. Leave blank to send no message.
text.name: _MessageWhenNoneLeft

boolean.desc: Check this box to display a numerical counter of the number of items left.
boolean.name: _DisplayCounter

number.desc: Horizontal offset to display the number of items left
number.name: _DisplayXOffset

number.desc: Vertical offset to display the number of items left
number.name: _DisplayYOffset

font.desc: Font used to display the number of items left.
font.name: _DisplayFont

boolean.desc: Check this box to switch the scene when no items are left.
boolean.name: _SwitchSceneWhenNoneLeft

scene.desc: Select the Scene to switch to when there are no items left.
scene.name: _SceneToSwitchTo

number.desc: Enter the time to fade out.
number.name: _SceneFadeOutTime

number.desc: Enter the time to fade in.
number.name: _SceneFadeInTime

snippet.desc: Make the actor's position relative to the screen.
snippet.description: Make the actor's position relative to the screen.
snippet.name: Anchor to Screen

snippet.desc: Emphasises the actor in some way when the cursor is placed over it. Options include fade, grow, shrink, brighten, darken and more.
snippet.description: Emphasises the actor in some way when the cursor is placed over it. Options include fade, grow, shrink, brighten, darken and more.
snippet.name: Emphasise On Mouse Over

text.desc: The type of emphasis applied to the actor on mouse over. Includes fade, grow, shrink, brighten and darken.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Grow=Grow Shrink=Shrink Turn Clockwise=Turn Clockwise Turn Anti-Clockwise=Turn Anti-Clockwise Brighten=Brighten Darken=Darken Tint=Tint Grayscale=Grayscale Negative=Negative Sepia=Sepia
text.name: _TypeOfEmphasis

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds, which it should take for the actor to go from unemphasised to emphasised. Only applies to grow, shrink and fade.
number.name: _EmphasisTime

number.desc: The amount, as a percentage, to emphasise the actor by, relative to it's normal state (don't use negative values). Does not apply to grayscale, negative and sepia.
number.name: _EmphasisAmount

color.desc: The colour to use, if you are using the tint option.
color.name: _TintingColour

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _NormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _PressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _HoverAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the activated button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _ActivatedNormalAnimation

number.desc:
The channel to mute.
Only used if Mute Channel is selected.
number.name: _Channel

boolean.desc:
If selected, only one channel will be muted.
Otherwise all sounds will be muted.
boolean.name: _MuteChannel

animation.desc: Animation for the activated button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _ActivatedPressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the activated button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _ActivatedHoverAnimation

snippet.desc: A button to reload the scene.
snippet.description: A button to reload the scene.
snippet.name: Reload Scene Button

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _NormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _PressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _HoverAnimation

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the reload transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

snippet.desc: Attach this behaviour to an actor to have it fade out after the specified time and over a specified duration
snippet.description: Attach this behaviour to an actor to have it fade out after the specified time and over a specified duration
snippet.name: Fade After Time

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds, over which to fade out.
number.name: _FadeTime

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds after which the actor should start fading.
number.name: _TimetoFadeAfter

boolean.desc: An INTERNAL attribute to determine whether or not the actor is already fading.
boolean.name: _Fading

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor is killed after fading out.
boolean.name: _KillAfterFade

snippet.desc: Create animations consisting of several successively playing animations.
snippet.description: Create animations consisting of several successively playing animations.
snippet.name: Endless Animation

list.desc:
Animations that should be played like a single animation have to be named with a common prefix followed by '-', followed by a number specifying the order of the animations.
For example:
Anim-1
Anim-2
Anim-3

To treat an animations as a single animation, add
Prefix,StartIndex,EndIndex
to the list. In the example above, you would add Anim,1,3 to the list.

You can change the mode for each set of animations by providing a forth parameter in the list entry
Prefix,StartIndex,EndIndex,Mode
where Mode must be Loop, Stop or Reverse.
list.name: _AnimationList

text.desc:
The default mode used if no mode is specified in a list entry.
Loop - Continue with the first animation after the last animation.
Stop - Stop after the last animation.
Reverse - Reverse the order in which the animations are played after playing the last or first animation.
text.name: _DefaultMode
